title: Restaurant given one star reviews before opening for previewing controversial menu
text:

A chef with dreams of attaining a Michelin Star received backlash before opening night of his new restaurant due to a controversial addition to the menu.

Maximillian Bennett previewed the menu for Barnetts at the Old Bank House, in Somerset, but was soon forced to make changes after one star reviews and negative comments rolled in.

The 28-year-old 's original menu included foie gras, the liver of a duck or goose.

Animal activists and groups such as PETA have condemned the dish as animal cruelty, with the process requiring pipes to be put down the animal's throats so they can be force fed, often enlarging the liver by up to 10 times its normal size.

The restaurant posted on social media to ask if the dish should be kept on the menu and removed it after the post received a barrage of angry comments, as reported by the Metro .

A statement was then released on Facebook by the restaurant to explain the reasoning behind the decision and also to express disappointment at some of the more extreme and threatening comments which had been left.

It said the team understand foie gras is a 'delicate' matter which is why the public was given a say in whether it was served, and listened to the 'resounding verdict' in the decision to remove it.

"We did not want to argue nor did we want to start a debate - civil or otherwise. However, given that Facebook has a commenting section it spiralled rather quickly to which we weren’t expecting.

"We were merely asking for a yes or a no; it was finalised as a firm no (take it off the menu) so respecting this, we have removed the dish.

"We have taken into account that we have offended some of you, so for that, we apologise.

"On the other hand, we are saddened by the fact that not all opinions offered were delivered with dignity and consideration. It is never acceptable to make threats. Nor are the recommendations just as we have not even opened yet!

"The comments and private messages were extreme to say the least, considering that in our poll we shared no opinion about the matter. We were trying to connect with the community and some felt the need to punish us for our earnestness."

It finished by stating they hope to close the chapter on the episode and to welcome some friendly faces in the restaurant.

Maximillian has said he hopes the pub will be fully open in the first week of November.
description: Barnetts at the Old Bank House criticised people who left 'extreme' comments and made threats when they posted about the menu on social media
